definition: to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense

sentences.english: Non-public capital is allowed to enter the monopolized industries and fields.
sentences.chinese: 允許非公有資本進入壟斷行業和領域。

sentences.english: Sixth: No reasonable price system in the natural monopoly industry.
sentences.chinese: 第六，自然壟斷行業的價格體系不合理。

sentences.english: This practice also eliminates illnesses and purifies disturbances by evil spirits .
sentences.chinese: 斷行法也能根除疾病，斷除外界邪魔的干擾。

sentences.english: Line breaks are normalized to "#xA" on input, before parsing.
sentences.chinese: 解析之前輸入中的斷行規範化爲“#xA”。

sentences.english: The actual results have no line breaks, and are "crammed" together all on one line.
sentences.chinese: 實際的結果沒有斷行，而是連成一行。

sentences.english: Moreover, some traditional industries has introduced the competition mechanism.
sentences.chinese: 實踐中，傳統的自然壟斷行業有些已經引入競爭機制。

sentences.english: Second, we will deepen the reform of the income distribution system of monopoly industries.
sentences.chinese: 二要深化壟斷行業收入分配製度改革。

sentences.english: Use comma for a line break.
Monopoly industries should carry out reforms to introduce competition mechanisms.
sentences.chinese: 推進壟斷行業改革，積極引入競爭機制。

sentences.english: Substantive progress was made in restructuring the management system of monopoly industries.
sentences.chinese: 壟斷行業管理體制改革邁出實質性步伐。

sentences.english: It should be used primarily to hyphenate words in justified type.
sentences.chinese: 他應該使用於字母斷行連接時。
